The study involved advanced infrared imaging with AI-driven and was published in the Journal of Gun Launch & Control.

Google is taking the technology from the virtual world.

articles.title: Is China Pulling Ahead on AI?
articles.author: Aubrey Harris
articles.summary: DeepSeek launched in January, but Americans didn't pay much attention to it. China's economy seems to have suddenly hit a fast track, thanks to the possibility of cheaply produced powerful AI. Last week, a Wuhan-based tech company released an AI assistant named Manus, which became so popular within the first few hours of its release that the servers crashed. American tech companies have been hampered by the Biden administration's regulations on artificial intelligence in the last four years.

articles.title: DeepSeek dims shine of AI stars
articles.author: Hector RETAMAL
articles.summary: China-based DeepSeek shook up the world of generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) early this year with a low-cost but high-performance model that challenges the hegemony of OpenAI and other big-spending behemoths. Since late 2022, just a handful of AI assistants have reigned supreme, thanks to multi-billion-dollar investments in engineers, data centers, and AI chips.

articles.title: Tech Matters: Google's next big thing is here — AI-only search
articles.summary: Google has launched an experimental version of Search where results are entirely generated by its artificial intelligence model, Gemini. It's currently available only to Google One AI Premium subscribers, with a waitlist for those who want to try it at some time in the future. Microsoft has been integrating AI into Bing for over a year, Perplexity AI offers a similar AI-generated approach, and OpenAI's ChatGPT is becoming a search alternative.

articles.title: AI chatbot helps victims of digital sexual violence in Latin America
articles.author: Zina DESMAZES
articles.summary: OlimpIA is an artificial intelligence chatbot developed in Mexico to help victims of online sexual violence. It provides legal advice and emotional support through WhatsApp messaging platform using several dozen languages. It was created by two women from Mexico and Ecuador who spent years fighting to be recognized as victims of sexual violence online.
